metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34526 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack overflow was discovered in the _TIFFVGetField function of Tiffsplit v4.4.0. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted TIFF file parsed by the "tiffsplit" or "tiffcrop" utilities.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.4.0-4
libtiff-tools - 4.4.0-4
libtiff5 - 4.4.0-4
libtiffxx5 - 4.4.0-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-4').
